evidence begins back in the spring of
Keith Hearn was a researcher at the
University of Hull who met a lucid
dreamer named Alvin Worsley who said he
could become consciously aware within
his dreams
and Keith Hearn wondered well how could
you scientifically validate lucid

he brought Alan Worsley into the sleep

will have these rapid eye movement
polygraph pads on your eyes that shows
you're in regular dreaming but when you

movement polygraph pad readout and
that'll provide evidence for lucid

remained in the Sleep state
so it was April 12th of 1975 Alan

right eight times and that was the very
first evidence for lucid dreaming
two years later at Stanford University
